verses.roman:
kṛṣṇera svābhāvika tina-śakti-pariṇati
cic-chakti, jīva-śakti, āra māyā-śakti

synonyms: kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; svābhāvika—natural; tina—three; śakti—of energies; pariṇati—transformations; cit-śakti—spiritual potency; jīva-śakti—spiritual sparks, living entities; āra—and; māyā-śakti—illusory energy.
translation: "Lord Kṛṣṇa naturally has three energetic transformations, and these are known as the spiritual potency, the living entity potency and the illusory potency.
